trans-unit.source: Using the BizTalk Edifact Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the BizTalk Edifact Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the BizTalk Edifact Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the BizTalk Edifact Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Use the Edifact service to receive and send messages over the Edifact protocol in business to business communications.
trans-unit.target: Use the Edifact service to receive and send messages over the Edifact protocol in business to business communications.

trans-unit.source: Edifact is also commonly referred to as ASC Edifact or Accredited Standards Committee Edifact and is widely used across industries.
trans-unit.target: Edifact is also commonly referred to as ASC Edifact or Accredited Standards Committee Edifact and is widely used across industries.

trans-unit.source: You can add the BizTalk Edifact connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: You can add the BizTalk Edifact connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: TPM API App: Before creating a Edifact connector, you have to create a <linkText>BizTalk Trading Partner Management Connector[1]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: TPM API App: Before creating a Edifact connector, you have to create a <linkText>BizTalk Trading Partner Management Connector[1]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: SQL Azure database: Each of the B2B API Apps requires its own Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: SQL Azure database: Each of the B2B API Apps requires its own Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Azure Service Bus: This is optional, and used only in the case of batching.
trans-unit.target: Azure Service Bus: This is optional, and used only in the case of batching.

trans-unit.source: To use the Edifact Connector, you need to first create an instance of the AS2 Connector API app.
trans-unit.target: To use the Edifact Connector, you need to first create an instance of the AS2 Connector API app.

trans-unit.source: This can be done either inline while creating a logic app or by selecting the AS2 Connector API app from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: This can be done either inline while creating a logic app or by selecting the AS2 Connector API app from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: Trading partners are the entities involved in B2B (Business-to-Business) communications.
trans-unit.target: Trading partners are the entities involved in B2B (Business-to-Business) communications.

trans-unit.source: When two partners establish a relationship, this is referred to as an Agreement.
trans-unit.target: When two partners establish a relationship, this is referred to as an Agreement.

trans-unit.source: The agreement defined is based on the communication the two partners wish to achieve and is protocol or transport specific.
trans-unit.target: The agreement defined is based on the communication the two partners wish to achieve and is protocol or transport specific.

trans-unit.source: Steps involved in creating a trading partner agreement is documented <linkText>here[2]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Steps involved in creating a trading partner agreement is documented <linkText>here[2]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Edifact Connector can be used either as a trigger or as an action.
trans-unit.target: Edifact Connector can be used either as a trigger or as an action.

trans-unit.source: Launch the Azure Logic Apps flow designer
trans-unit.target: Launch the Azure Logic Apps flow designer

trans-unit.source: Click on Edifact Connector from the right pane: <linkText>Trigger settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Click on Edifact Connector from the right pane: <linkText>Trigger settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click on ->: <linkText>Trigger options</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Click on ->: <linkText>Trigger options</linkText>

trans-unit.source: EDIFACT Connector exposes a single trigger.
trans-unit.target: EDIFACT Connector exposes a single trigger.

trans-unit.source: Select Release Batch: Release batch input
trans-unit.target: Select Release Batch: Release batch input

trans-unit.source: This trigger has no inputs.
trans-unit.target: This trigger has no inputs.

trans-unit.source: Click on ->: <linkText>Release batch configured</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Click on ->: <linkText>Release batch configured</linkText>

trans-unit.source: As part of the output, the connector returns the Edifact payload, agreement id as well as information as to whether the message is batched, or not.
trans-unit.target: As part of the output, the connector returns the Edifact payload, agreement id as well as information as to whether the message is batched, or not.

trans-unit.source: Click on Edifact Connector from the right pane: <linkText>Action settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Click on Edifact Connector from the right pane: <linkText>Action settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click on ->: <linkText>List of Actions</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Click on ->: <linkText>List of Actions</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Edifact connector supports many actions.
trans-unit.target: Edifact connector supports many actions.

trans-unit.source: Select Encode: Encode input
trans-unit.target: Select Encode: Encode input

trans-unit.source: Provide the inputs for the action and configure it: <linkText>Encode configured</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Provide the inputs for the action and configure it: <linkText>Encode configured</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Parameter|Type|Description of the parameter ---|---|--- Content|string|XML Message Agreement ID|integer|Agreement ID Is Batched Message|boolean|Is Batched Message Data Element Separator|string|Data Element Separator Component Separator|string|Component Separator Segment Terminator|string|Segment Terminator Decimal Point Indicator|string|Decimal Point Indicator Repetition Separator|string|Repetition Separator Escape Character|string|Escape Character Replacement Character|string|Replacement Character Segment Terminator Suffix|string|Segment Terminator Suffix
trans-unit.target: Parameter|Type|Description of the parameter ---|---|--- Content|string|XML Message Agreement ID|integer|Agreement ID Is Batched Message|boolean|Is Batched Message Data Element Separator|string|Data Element Separator Component Separator|string|Component Separator Segment Terminator|string|Segment Terminator Decimal Point Indicator|string|Decimal Point Indicator Repetition Separator|string|Repetition Separator Escape Character|string|Escape Character Replacement Character|string|Replacement Character Segment Terminator Suffix|string|Segment Terminator Suffix

trans-unit.source: The action returns an object containing the EDIFACT payload on successful completion.
trans-unit.target: The action returns an object containing the EDIFACT payload on successful completion.

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business flow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business flow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at <linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at <linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Manage and Monitor API apps and connector</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Manage and Monitor API apps and connector</linkText><title></title>.
